SENT.plain: A 3-year-old boy with infection by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) developed stage IV Burkitt's lymphoma
Complete remission was achieved with the BFM-86 protocol
One month after finishing treatment, and still in complete remission, fever appeared and seropositivity to HIV was found
The child was diagnosed of AIDS (P2-E1) and died 10 days later
Although the association of HIV infection and Burkitt's lymphoma is well known in adults, it is extremely rare in children
The routine HIV screening is suggested for children with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma
